contextId.information: These two opposite things are a merism that refers to everything the king does. AT: "You must stay near the king at all times" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: You must stay with the king when he goes out, and when he comes in

contextId.information: This is a merism that means "everyone," which is a generalization. AT: "from the least important to the most important" or "everyone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: from the least to the greatest
